data.title: Feature Request: Open error window when errors are found
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2

I would like the problems window to automatically open when a problem is found by the task runner.
Would it be possible to implement this feature?

data.title: Line number no longer used in quick open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: OSX Yosemite

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open quick open with Command P
2. Type in a file name with line number (authorization.js:88)
3. File is never found. it should find authorization.js and scroll to line 88.

data.title: support running from CLI with :line:collumn
data.body:
I'd like to request a new CLI feature to match Atom and Sublime text. These editors both can start from cli and jump to line and collumn.

For example when I run:

```
code /home/capaj/git_projects/error-pitcher/test/error-thrown.js:3:10
```

I would expect to have the file opened and my cursor on line 3 column 10.
Currently the file is not opened, because VScode thinks those double dots are a part of file name.

It would be great to have this. If you're interested in my usecase- I am developing a hyperterm plugin https://github.com/capaj/hyperterm-clicky and it would be awesome if users could open up files easily straight from their terminal for VS code as well as they do now for Atom and Sublime text.

data.title: Explorer: files with spaces produces bad CSS classes
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a file `foo hidden bar.txt` 
   => file gets hidden from explorer because `hidden` is a top level CSS rule to hide something

We should do some simple CSS escaping for whitespace.

@aeschli fyi

data.title: Problems after last update (1.5.2) with less files and autocompiler
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:
1. One less file with more than 2000 lines
2. CTRL+S to save and autocompile... vscode hangs
3. Need to kill the process and restart vscode

data.title: Explorer no longer shows "..." for cropped file labels
data.body:
A regression from using `display: inline-block` for the labels.

@aeschli fyi

data.title: Inform users that they are running a patched version of VS Code
data.body: There are some extensions that patch the VS Code bits. Since such a configuration hasn't been tested we need to inform the user that they are running an untested/unsupported version of VS Code.

data.title: Debt - Revisit and improve the use of the editor inside the debug console

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.title: Debug adapters can't return an object from a setVariableRequest
data.body:
The protocol only lets them return a string in SetVariableResponse, but you can edit a variable to be an object. 

Either the response should contain a Variable, or vscode should do another variables request for the object/scope that was edited.

data.title: Support bundling extensions from Marketplace at build time
data.body:
cc @weinand @roblourens 
- [x] Query bundled extensions
- [x] Bundle extensions at build time
- [x] Prevent installation of these extensions from the Marketplace

data.title: Automaticly assign Tab name from file content

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
One really usefull feature of Sublime Text (and some other Text Editor) is that the tabs are automaticly named by the beginning of a file openned in it.
You can easly create new tab and write things and find them between other openned tabs.

As the Hot File saving feature is comming, this feature is also really important to find the tab you want faster than seeking trough your openned tab.

How it works right now in VSCode:
![vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10771995/18511880/97cfe4c0-7a86-11e6-91d2-534df02cf4f8.PNG)

How Sublime Manage tabs:
![vscode_sublime](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10771995/18511887/9f8b3e4e-7a86-11e6-96f7-4b1b4a16b397.PNG)

data.title: Fix Perl POD comment syntax highlighting
data.body:
- because there is a false positive when using spaceship
  operator at the beginning of line
- this inspired by http://perldoc.perl.org/perlpodspec.html

data.title: Double click to edit variables should select the text
data.body: Double click a variable to edit it - I think the text in the input should now be highlighted, so I can just start typing to replace it. I think they probably want to replace all the text, not edit it.

data.title: Explorer should not trim leading or trailing whitespaces

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Currently we do this to help the user not producing potentially wrong files name because by accident a space was typed.

data.title: Extension marketplace caching issues

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
1. Have an extension installed in version 1
2. Publish an update (version 2)
3. Uninstall the extension
4. Search for it, confirm that version 2 shows up
5. Install it

Version 1 appears installed

@egamma @dbaeumer please confirm whether the steps approximate what you experienced

data.title: Updater should delete /out/ folder
data.body: - possibly dangerous garbage is left behind

data.title: Debug broken or changed?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: latest over-night build
- OS Version: latest OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Debug an existing Node.js project that worked yesterday
2. `Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly`
3. Copy and paste and get: `Error: Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly (occurred again)`

data.title: Uninstaller should have option to remove all data

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Perhaps behind a prompt, but IMHO we should offer to remove:
- all the folder C:\users\xxx.vscode-insiders
- all the folder %APPDATA%\Code-Insiders

oftentimes people try to reinstall us if they get in trouble, but that doesn't really do anything since all the settings + extensions + Chrome cache thing (localstorage, etc) are all maintained/left behind

data.title: Setting Cmder.exe as integrated shell still opens in separate window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In user settings add `"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Program Files (x86)\\cmder\\Cmder.exe",`
2. Press `ctrl` + `backtick`
3. Notice Cmder opens in separate window after trying to open in integrated spot.

data.title: Prune find traversal with basename patterns
data.body:
@bpasero FYI, one way of addressing the performance regression with large node_modules #11874 would be to use -prune with find. Alternatively we could turn off the use of find. What do you think?

The string overflow #11842 and the multiple parallel find processes #11181 are separate bugs that need to be fixed, they are amplified by this one.
